attributes.additional_details:
What crime does a criminal have a 99.75% chance of getting away with? Fly-tipping!

It is the scourge of the British towns and countryside and in 09/10 there were 947,000 'incidents' in England and Wales that cost at least £100m, yet the rate of successful prosecution was just 0.25% !

DEFRA, councils, police and CPS must be more aggressive in prosecuting offenders and fines must increase to cover the cost of cleanup, remediation and any direct economic loss suffered by a private business or landowner.
